page.title: 16RELIGION 1
page.content: The area has a twelth Century Anglican Church in High Offley, and a Methodist Chapel built in the last quarter of the nineteenth Century in Woodseaves. The Anglican Parish of High Offley has recently been joined with the Parish of Norbury, and now has three churches, two of which are out of the area covered by this survey. The Rector of the joint Parishes lives in Woodseaves. Services at the three churches are conducted on a rota basis, for example at Saint Mary's High Offley on the first, & third Sundays each month there is a Communion Service at 9.00 a.m., and Evensong at 18.30 p.m. On the second and fourth Sundays Communion is held at 10.00 a.m and there is no Evensong at High Offley.
